meanings.definition: A plant with spiny leaves or stems.
meanings.sent1: The acanth in the garden has sharp leaves.
meanings.sent2: I saw an acanth with spiky stems in the forest.
meanings.sent3: Be careful not to touch the acanth in the park; it can prick you!
meanings.sent4: The acanth stood tall in the field, its spiny leaves gleaming in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The acanth's spiky stems made it stand out among the other plants.

meanings.sent1: The cat felt the acanth of the cactus and jumped away.
meanings.sent2: The acanth on the rose bush pricked my finger.
meanings.sent3: The acanth on the hedgehog's back looked like tiny spikes.
meanings.sent4: His words had an acanth of truth that couldn't be ignored.
meanings.sent5: The acanth on the porcupine's quills served as a natural defense mechanism.

meanings.sent1: She carefully removed the acanth from her foot after stepping on a thorn.
meanings.sent2: The acanth on the cactus was sharp and dangerous.
meanings.sent3: The acanth on the rose bush seemed to be teasing anyone who came close.
meanings.sent4: His words had an acanth of criticism that stung deeply.
meanings.sent5: The acanth on the caterpillar's body acted as a deterrent to predators.
